title: CAPITALISM: A LOVE STORY
description: Filmmaker Michael Moore takes on capitalism's roots, the floundering U.S. economy, and 2008's global financial meltdown.

title: Captive
description: This documentary series reconstructs history's most complex, high-stakes hostage negotiations as kidnapping victims recount their terrifying ordeals.

title: Cartel Land
description: This documentary offers an up-close look at two vigilante groups that have formed in Mexico in response to the increasing dominance of drug cartels.

title: Casting JonBenet
description: Local actors from JonBenet Ramsey's hometown offer multiple perspectives on her 1996 murder as they vie to play roles in a dramatization of the case.

title: Catching the Sun
description: This documentary explores the worldwide economics of the burgeoning solar energy industry and its impact on hopeful job seekers in the United States.

title: Cave of Forgotten Dreams
description: This fascinating documentary offers an unprecedented look at France's Chauvet Cave, which contains the oldest human-painted images found on Earth.
actors: Werner Herzog, Charles Fathy, Dominique Baffier, Jean Clottes

title: Chasing Coral
description: Divers, scientists and photographers around the world mount an epic underwater campaign to document the disappearance of coral reefs.

title: Chasing Trane
description: Featuring interviews, insights and archival footage, this documentary aims to reveal how historical events shaped the music of John Coltrane.
actors: Denzel Washington, Bill Clinton, Ravi Coltrane, Common

title: Chef's Table: France
description: Sample the bold new flavors of France with chefs who are pushing the boundaries of fine dining and reinventing a rich culinary tradition.

title: Chicken Soup for the Soul's Being Dad
description: Nine dads around America with different family structures, backgrounds and jobs navigate the joys and challenges of fatherhood.

title: Children of God
description: A former member examines the lingering effects of being raised in the Family, a cult whose disturbing practices include the sexual abuse of children.

title: Chris Brown: Welcome to My Life
description: Featuring interviews, concert footage and behind-the-scenes access, this documentary delivers fans an all-access look at the life of Chris Brown.

title: Christiane Amanpour: Sex & Love Around the World
description: A contextual, acculturated dive into how adults in six, big global cities celebrate love and accentuate sex. CNN's Christiane Amanpour reports.

title: Christmas Cracker
description: It's more than a slight case of holiday madness for these Christmas-obsessed people, who love to celebrate Yuletide -- sometimes all year long.

title: Churchill's First World War
description: Relying on his intimate letters to his wife, this docudrama examines Winston Churchill's extraordinary experiences during the Great War.

title: City 40
description: This documentary uses secret filming to penetrate the limits of a hidden Russian city whose inhabitants are bound to a bizarre nuclear arrangement.

title: City of Joy
description: Women who've been sexually brutalized in war-torn Congo begin to heal at City of Joy, a center that helps them regain a sense of self and empowerment.

title: City of Trees
description: A grassroots nonprofit faces mounting pressure as it aims to create jobs and improve Washington, D.C., parks through a special tree-planting program.

title: Code Black
description: Doctor and filmmaker Ryan McGarry takes viewers inside the world of a public hospital -- his own -- for a close-up look at the ailing medical system.

title: CODE: Debugging the Gender Gap
description: Experts and coders alike examine gender and racial inequities in the computer science world and spotlight efforts to correct the imbalance.

title: Command and Control
description: Chronicling a 1980 Titan II missile accident, this sobering documentary weighs the balance of power and safety involving weapons of mass destruction.

title: Conflict
description: Six conflict photographers reflect on their experiences capturing the atrocities of war and other manifestations of violence on film.

title: Conspiracy Theory: Did We Land On The Moon?
description: Skeptics and experts discuss photographs and other evidence that suggest the United States government faked NASA's moon landings for political gain.

title: Cooked
description: As he tries his hand at baking, brewing and braising, acclaimed food writer Michael Pollan explores how cooking transforms food and shapes our world.

title: Cosmodrome
description: Get a look at the sophisticated engines Russia designed for a Cold War-era moon landing and how a changing world led them to a strange fate.

title: Country: Portraits of an American Sound
description: Iconic photographs and interviews with Roseanne Cash, Merle Haggard, Charley Pride and many other artists chronicle decades of American country music.
actors: Garth Brooks, Tanya Tucker, Kenny Rogers, Lee Ann Womack

title: Covered: Alive in Asia
description: Christian musician Israel Houghton leads his band Israel & New Breed on a tour supporting their newest album of multicultural, hybrid-genre songs.

title: Cowspiracy: The Sustainability Secret
description: Learn how factory farming is decimating the planet's natural resources -- and why this crisis has been largely ignored by major environmental groups.

title: Cuba and the Cameraman
description: Emmy-winning filmmaker Jon Alpert chronicles the fortunes of three Cuban families over the course of four tumultuous decades in the nation's history.

title: Curse of the Man Who Sees UFOs
description: Filmmaker Justin Gaar probes the odd but intriguing mind of longtime UFO videographer Christo Roppolo and shares footage from his many UFO sightings.

title: Cutie and the Boxer
description: A 2014 Oscar nominee for Best Documentary Feature, this film explores the symbiotic relationship of artists Ushio and Noriko Shinohara.
